ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This is a continuation of the grammar that you learn in 130.
Nearly all of French Grammar, great practice reading and discussing French literature.

- fine-tuned grammar
- insight into francophone literature around the globe
- closely studied Occupation of France during WWII
I improved my French writing, speaking and listening skills.
Definitely improved my French speaking, reading, and writing abilities.
This class allowed me to greatly improve my ability to read, write, listen to, and speak the French language, in addition to exposing me to numerous texts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: use of the Course Packet with linked audio programs.
Weakness: too much reading assigned per night--> should be dialed down.

- exams were of reasonable difficulty
- class time was structured well
- texts covered important topics / were meaningful -- except La symphonie pastorale
- make the course packet available on Canvas!!
It was very much conversation based.
I think there could be a greater focus on conversing with each other and engaging with other students in French conversation.
This class is very strong in encouraging engagement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to anyone really looking to learn French. The amount of work that goes into it is really geared towards making sure students understand the French language.
Yes, it was great for improving my own French.
Yes! Great selection of short stories and films. Compared to L2/L3, L4 has a more reasonable workload; and it actually revisited several L2 grammar topics.
Yes, if you really want to improve your French, this course helps you a lot!
Yes, if you want to improve your french - it is a lot of reading though so be prepared.
I would recommend this course, with the warning that it will be very difficult and a significant amount of work.
